MarkovChain Methods and Code¶

class moore_braidgenerator.markovchain.MarkovChain(**kwargs)¶

MarkovChain is an encapsulation of the Markov Chain. It takes a BraidWord and allows modelling, which creates a specified number of isomorphs along with the logs pertaining to that isomorph (i.e. which Markov Move was made at some iteration).

Parameters

  • braidword (BraidWord) – A BraidWord to have isomorphs generated

  • it. Note that a simple Python list can be given as a (from) –

  • as well, which will be converted to a BraidWord behind (parameter) –

  • scenes. (the) –

  • maxgen (int) – The maximum absolute value a generator can be in the

  • and its subsequent isomorphisms. (BraidWord) –

  • maxlen (int) – The maxmimum length of that any subsequent isomorphs

  • reach. (can) –

word¶

A list containing generators.

Type

list

largestGenerator¶

The largest generator of the absolute value of generators in the word. genCount (list): A list containing quantities of generators that exist in word, indexed from generator number minus one.

Type

int

Examples¶
>>> mc = MarkovChain(braidword=[1, 2, 3], maxgen=9, maxlen=10)
>>> mc.braid.word

[1, 2, 3]

>>> mc.maxgen
9

>>> mc.maxlen
10
aggregate()¶

Method to return a dictionary of MarkovChain instance’s isomorphs and logs, both contained in their respective lists. That is, returns self.braidagg.

clear_model()¶

Method to clear braid instance. That is, it clears self.braidagg.

isomorphs(as_word=False)¶

Method to return MarkovChain instance isomorphs in a list.

Parameters

  • as_word (bool) – Determines if isomorphs should be returned

  • words or BraidWords. (as) –

Returns

If True returns isomorphs as words (list). Otherwise returns them as BraidWords (of class BraidWord).

static log_message(movetype: int, name: str, result: bool) → str¶

Function to dynamically create log of move @mstep

Parameters

  • movetype (int) – Markov Move[i] for i in [0, 6], inclusive. There

  • 7 Markov Moves that determine the braid-to-isomorph modification. (are) –

  • name (str) – The name of the Markov Move.

  • result (bool) – Boolean representing whether the move was successfully

  • or not. (executed) –

Returns

String of log for BraidWord.word at Markov Move [i] for i in [0, 6], inclusive.

logs()¶

Method to return MarkovChain instance logs in a list.

Note that the length of the list is equal to the number of isomorphisms requested in the num_isomorphs argument of model.

Each log represents the logs undergone to create a specific isomorphism and is held in a dictionary. The size of the dictionary is equal to the argument passed for msteps in model.

model(num_isomorphs: int = 1, msteps: int = 100)¶

Method to model the BraidWord and generate isomorphs and logs.

A random number is picked between (0, 6), inclusive, determining the Markov Move to perform.

Another random number is picked from range(len(BraidWord.word)) that represents the index of BraidWord.word to perform the Markov Move on.

The isomorph is generated by picking a random index from the set of possible indices for BraidWord.word and a random Markov Move that acts on BraidWord.word at the given index.

Parameters

  • num_isomorphs (int) – Number of isomorphs to be modeled from

  • BraidWord given to the Markov Chain. (the) –

  • msteps (int) – The number of steps to be taken until an isomorph

  • considered to be complete. That is, msteps many iterations (is) –

  • the model process take place on a given BraidWord. (of) –

Returns

Appends isomorph and log to self.braidagg.

new_braidword()¶

Method to set a new BraidWord.

Parameters

  • braidword (BraidWord) – The new BraidWord to replace the old

  • BraidWord. –

Returns

Replaces self.braid with braidword.

tocsv(path_or_filename='', only_isomorphs=False)¶

Method to export logs, isomorphs to csv.

If path_or_filename not given, will export the csv to current directory with the name Isomorphs.csv or Isomorphs_and_Logs.csv. The name is implicitly determined by the parameter passed to only_isomorphs.

Parameters

  • path_or_filename (str) – Path or filename to store csv.

  • only_isomorphs (bool) – Determines if only isomorphs

  • be returned or both isomorphs and logs. (should) –

Returns

A csv file containing a dataframe with either only isomorphs or both isomorphs and logs, depending on parameter passed to only_isomorphs.

topandas(only_isomorphs=False)¶

Method to export logs, isomorphs to pandas df.

Parameters

  • only_isomorphs (bool) – Determines if only isomorphs

  • be returned or both isomorphs and logs. (should) –

Returns

If only_isomorphs=True returns a pandas dataframe of only isomorphs. Otherwise will return a pandas dataframe with both isomorphs and logs.

totxt(path_or_filename='', only_isomorphs=False)¶

Method to export logs, isomorphs to a txt file.

If path_or_filename not given, will export the csv to current directory with the name Isomorphs.txt or Isomorphs_and_Logs.txt. The name is implicitly determined by the parameter passed to only_isomorphs.

The format in the .txt is vertical, as follows:

isomorph[1] isomorph[2] . . . isomorph[n]

log[1] log[2] . . . log[n]

Parameters

  • path_or_filename (str) – Path or filename to store txt.

  • only_isomorphs (bool) – Determines if only isomorphs

  • be returned or both isomorphs and logs. (should) –

Returns

A txt file containing a either only isomorphs or both isomorphs and logs, depending on parameter passed to only_isomorphs.
